alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 7:34PM CST until January 28 at 12:52AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following counties, Clarke, Mobile and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 731 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are estimated to have fallen over the past hour. Additional storms will continue to move over the advisory area during the next 1 to 2 hours. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Grove Hill, Leroy, Wagarville, Saint Stephens, Whatley, Calvert, Mount Vernon, McIntosh, Movico, Rockville, Walker Springs, Carson, Prestwick, Carlton, Choctaw Bluff, Wagar, Alma, Cortelyou and Sunflower. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
